A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Last Jedi's shortcomings are too numerous to remember...

- Its awkward\, self-aware humour. 

- Its shambolic narrative structure (including a superfluous subplot on a casino planet that goes nowhere and achieves nothing).
 
- Its bizarre portrayal of classic characters (Leia Poppins... Luke the teet-milking\, petulant preteen... the man who redeemed Darth Vader\, contemplating murdering his nephew in his sleep for thinking bad thoughts). 

- All the questions it disregards: Who the hell was Snoke? How was he killed so easily? How did he turn Kylo Ren? Who were the 'Knights of Ren'?' How did Maz Katana get Luke's (and Anakin's) lightsaber from Bespin? 

If you want to see an actual heroic film that is moving and deep\, watch "Darkest Hour" instead. Now THAT is good storytelling... and its true!
